description_txt: stated on February 24, 2017 in on Twitter :
quote_txt: Said Adolf Hitler and Donald Trump have both described deportations as "a military operation."

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: The GOP’s Obamacare replacement would reduce subsidies that help lower-income people buy health insurance, but also "expand the entitlement" by giving subsidies to higher-income people "that Obamacare never helped."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2017 in remarks in Coral Springs, Fla.:
quote_txt: Says President Donald Trump’s proposal to allow Americans to buy health insurance across state lines would make it the same as "the way you buy car insurance" today.

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in Internet posts:
quote_txt: Says "(Barack) Obama’s mother-in-law charged with larceny and fraud."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in a press briefing:
quote_txt: Says Paul Manafort "played a very limited role" in the Trump presidential campaign.

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "In year No. 1, 14 million Americans lose coverage," according to the CBO.

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in a rally in Kentucky:
quote_txt: "Since the day of my election, we've already cut illegal immigration at the southern border by 61 percent."

description_txt: stated on March 8, 2017 in a House Judiciary Committee hearing:
quote_txt: Wealthy foreigners can obtain visas through a special program, but only a small number "invest in true high-unemployment areas. Almost every other EB-5 project uses gerrymandering to qualify as distressed."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in a video:
quote_txt: Under "Trumpcare," the Republican replacement for Obamacare, "$600 billion worth of tax breaks will go to the wealthiest in this country."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in a headline:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Health and Human Services Secretary Tom Price said, "It’s better for our budget if cancer patients die more quickly."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in a press conference:
quote_txt: "There's no demonstrable evidence they (after-school programs that feed kids) are helping kids do better at school."

description_txt: stated on March 1, 2017 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press Daily":
quote_txt: "USAID put $8 billion up and attracted more than $45 billion in a public-private partnership called Power Africa."

description_txt: stated on March 2, 2017 in a post on Facebook:
quote_txt: Says Airbnb "decreases real estate values and increases costs for workforce housing."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in a House Intelligence Committee hearing:
quote_txt: "In recent years ... the Obama administration was committed to the notion, against all evidence, that we could reset relations with Putin."

description_txt: stated on March 20, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "The NSA and FBI tell Congress that Russia did not influence electoral process."

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2017 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Roughly one-fourth of rural Missourians are unable to purchase high-speed internet, which puts them at a disadvantage in everything from education to entertainment to health care."

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2017 in an interview on CNN:
quote_txt: "I remember years ago looking at a CBO report that in 1964 predicted that Medicare would cost $9 billion 10 years later. And I think it was already over $100 billion at that point."

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2017 in a post on Twitter:
quote_txt: "Germany owes ... vast sums of money to NATO & the United States must be paid more for the powerful, and very expensive, defense it provides to Germany!"

description_txt: stated on February 14, 2017 in a press release on her website:
quote_txt: Small businesses "create two out of every three American jobs."

description_txt: stated on February 23, 2017 in and in several other statements over the past two months.:
quote_txt: The proposed state budget contains "an additional tax cut for the middle class."

description_txt: stated on February 23, 2017 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "The average margin of victory in the House of Representatives was 37%" for Democrats and Republicans in the 2016 election.

description_txt: stated on March 5, 2017 in an interview:
quote_txt: Wisconsin is "the most -- if not Number 1, number 2 -- gerrymandered state in the country" for state legislative boundaries.

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2017 in an emailed press release:
quote_txt: "Texas legislators have filed voucher proposals in every legislative session since 1995, but all of them have failed to become law."

description_txt: stated on March 13, 2017 in a the GOP response to Roy Cooper's State of the State speech:
quote_txt: Says Republican legislators in North Carolina raised the average teacher's pay "by more than 15 percent in just three years."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2017 in a press conference in the Florida Capitol:
quote_txt: "Experts estimate that 40 percent of gun sales occur in no-questions-asked transactions that often take place at gun shows or on the Internet."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2017 in a San Antonio Express-News news story:
quote_txt: "There’s not one public study, and by public study I mean a study available to the public, that has looked at using the product Kaput to poison feral hogs."

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2017 in a speech at the City Club of Chicago:
quote_txt: "The past (Obama) administration was the first administration that never had a whole year of 3 percent growth."

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2017 in an interview with Fox's Tucker Carlson:
quote_txt: Says "the New York Times wrote about" Barack Obama wiretapping Donald Trump during the election.

description_txt: stated on March 12, 2017 in CNN's State of the Union:
quote_txt: "2009-2010, let's remember, hundreds of Republican amendments were adopted in the ACA."

description_txt: stated on March 15, 2017 in a Florida House floor speech:
quote_txt: "What has happened since 2005? We’ve seen violent crime continuously go down" due to Florida's "stand your ground" law.
